articles.title: Judge restricts federal use of tear gas, munitions at Portland ICE protests - OregonLive.com
articles.description: The temporary order lasts 14 days. A hearing is set for March 2 to extend the order.

articles.title: Defense Dept. effort to punish Mark Kelly draws skepticism from judge - The Washington Post
articles.description: A federal judge said Pete Hegseth appeared to be expanding restrictions on free speech that have applied only to active-duty service members.

articles.description: First reactions are calling 'Wuthering Heights' a 'bodice-ripping crowd-pleaser' that is 'destined to be a massive hit.'

articles.title: Ricky Martin issues public statement to Bad Bunny after Grammys: 'I know how heavy it is' - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: Ricky Martin has all the feels about Bad Bunny's historic night at the Grammy Awards on Sunday — and he's letting the world know in an open letter to his fellow Puerto Rican singer.

articles.title: ‘F1’ Sequel Teased By Racing Sport’s CEO At Apple TV Press Day - Deadline
articles.description: The biggest question heading into Apple TV press day was whether there would be a sequel to the biggest grossing sports movie of all-time and 4x Oscar nominee, F1. Taking a question from the audience, Apple’s SVP of Services, Eddie Cue, read it to Formula 1 C…

articles.title: Asian Stocks Poised to Track US Tech-Led Selloff: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg
articles.description: Asian stocks pared earlier losses, following US tech shares’ drop, on speculation regional companies have a broader mix of operations that makes them more resilient to the software-driven selloff.

articles.title: Lakers' Austin Reaves (calf) back in action against Nets - ESPN
articles.description: Austin Reaves, sidelined the past five weeks with a strained left calf, returned in the Lakers' 125-109 win against the Nets on Tuesday night, scoring 15 points on 3-for-9 shooting with four rebounds and two steals.

articles.title: College Football Playoff announces quarterfinal, semifinal dates, bowl sites for 2026, 2027 - On3
articles.description: The College Football Playoff announced the dates and bowl sites for its upcoming quarterfinal and semifinal games for the 2026, 2027 Playoffs.

articles.title: Grim photo captures polar bear mom and cubs resting in mud in summer heat - Live Science
articles.description: An image of polar bears napping along the Hudson Bay coast in Canada has been shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

articles.title: Republicans are freaking out about Hispanic voters after a Texas upset - Politico

articles.title: Anthropic’s Move Into Legal Is Sinking Data Services Stocks - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Once again, artificial intelligence is dominating investors’ attention in the stock market. These days, however, the focus is turning more and more toward companies that may get disrupted by the new technology rather than those who stand to profit from it.

articles.title: Fourteen migrants dead after collision with Greek coastguard boat - BBC

articles.title: Gabbard says Trump asked her to attend FBI raid at Georgia elections hub - Axios

articles.title: Nick Shirley sets his sights on California - The Verge
articles.description: Right-wing YouTuber Nick Shirley’s video about Minneapolis daycare centers resulted in federal agents swarming the city. Now he’s reportedly in San Diego running the same playbook.
